answers.answer: Nobody can diagnose you over the internet and this isn't the physicians' forum. I can tell you though if you have depression, then you can have some physical symptoms and that could include aches/pains and sleeping so much. I would consider talking to your physician about your depression; perhaps getting treated and see if you still have symptoms. If you are convinced that your physical symptoms started before your depression, then I would consider getting tested first for autoimmune conditions, thryoid problems, Sjogren's syndrome and vitamin deficiencies.

I also have been almost blacking out when I stand up.  This has happened more and more frequently lately!  It's like a darkness is closing in on me and I have to stop and close my eyes until it goes away and I can see again.

Feeling faint can be a symptom of fibromyalgia and/or CFS. I would recommend making sure your specialist is familiar with both of these illnesses and is also able to diagnose and treat both of these illnesses.Good luck !

Your symptoms also sound like diabetes symptoms. The dry skin, and the bruising. You should see your doctor for a complete phusical exam. There are so many different things that could be causing your problems, a complete blood workup is a place to start.

It could be diabetes, but I can tell you that my CFS has affected both my adrenal & pituitary gland and therefore, I now have dry skin. Before I was diagnosed and treated for CFS, I used to bruise and remember once I had a bruise for over 6 months !The poster definitely needs a complete workup and her physician should probably order a complete chem panel, including glucose, sed rate, lyme disease titer and an ANA to rule out the possibility of an autoimmune disease. If all of that is negative, I would then consider ordering hormone tests and an MRI of the brain.

Tell your doctor to to a complete "Adrenal workup" and test also you Pregnenolone.I had similar symptoms and once the doctor realized all my levels were low, he could then give me pregnenolone  and other supplements to take.   I am sleeping better and pain in now liveable.Jo
folic acid can help the dizzyness i think. it certainly did for me. at least take over the counter vitamins but you should be cked by a Doctor if you can. good luck.

question: I'm a 21 year old female.  Over the past couple years I've noticed myself getting lazier and sleepier, having aches and pains like I'm 50, popping knees when I squat down, and off and on depression.  Over this past year I became very lazy, even if I slept until 10 am! I have what just feels like very tender spots on my upper and especially lower back.  I bruise easily and the past couple days I've felt like I've had a constant slight headache.  My skin has become dry and just not looking how a 21 year old's skin should look!  Why do I feel like a senior??  Does this sound like fibromyalgia??  What should I do??
title: Do I have fibro???
